MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions options) cil managed
public: property bool AllowTrailingCommas { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowTrailingCommas : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Get or sets a value that indicates whether an extra comma at the end of a list of JSON values in an object or array is allowed (and ignored) within the JSON payload being deserialized.
Docs.value: if an extra comma at the end of a list of JSON values in an object or array is allowed (and ignored); otherwise.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
By default, `AllowTrailingCommas` is set to `false`, and a <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonException> is thrown during deserialization if a trailing comma is encountered.
For more information, see [How to serialize and deserialize JSON](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-how-to#allow-comments-and-trailing-commas).

Docs.exception: This property was set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Converters As IList(Of JsonConverter)

Docs.summary: Gets the list of user-defined converters that were registered.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Once serialization or deserialization occurs, the list cannot be modified.
For more information, see [How to write custom converters](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-converters-how-to#registration-sample---converters-collection).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int DefaultBufferSize { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.DefaultBufferSize : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the default buffer size, in bytes, to use when creating temporary buffers.
Docs.value: The default buffer size in bytes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The default buffer size, in bytes, is 16,384. For most workloads, the default size is a reasonable amount of JSON to buffer while reading from a stream or writing to a stream. That is, it performs well without creating objects on the Large Object Heap for the Garbage Collector (GC) to track. In non-streaming scenarios, increasing the default buffer size could improve performance for large JSON strings or UTF-8 byte arrays. We recommend that you leave this value unchanged unless changing it makes an observable difference in performance.

Docs.exception: The buffer size is less than 1.
This property was set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.

member this.DictionaryKeyPolicy : System.Text.Json.JsonNamingPolicy with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the policy used to convert a key's name to another format, such as camel-casing.
Docs.value: The policy used to convert a key's name to another format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This property can be set to <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonNamingPolicy.CamelCase?displayProperty=nameWithType> to specify a camel-casing policy.
This property can be set to <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonNamingPolicy.CamelCase> to specify a camel-casing policy.
It is not used when deserializing.
For more information, see [How to serialize and deserialize JSON](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-how-to#camel-case-dictionary-keys).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IgnoreNullValues { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.IgnoreNullValues : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether values are ignored during serialization and deserialization. The default value is .
Docs.value: to ignore null values during serialization and deserialization; otherwise, see langword="false" />.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
For more information, see [Exclude all null value properties](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-how-to#exclude-all-null-value-properties) and [Ignore null when deserializing](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-how-to#ignore-null-when-deserializing).

Docs.exception: This property was set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IgnoreReadOnlyProperties { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.IgnoreReadOnlyProperties : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets a value that determines whether read-only properties are ignored during serialization. The default value is .
Docs.value: to ignore read-only properties during serialization; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
A property is read-only if it contains a public getter but not a public setter.
Read-only properties are not deserialized regardless of this setting.
For more information, see [How to serialize and deserialize JSON](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-how-to#exclude-all-read-only-properties).

Docs.exception: This property was set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MaxDepth { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MaxDepth : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depth allowed when serializing or deserializing JSON, with the default value of 0 indicating a maximum depth of 64.
Docs.value: The maximum depth allowed when serializing or deserializing JSON.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Going past this depth throws a <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonException>.

Docs.exception: This property was set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.
The max depth is set to a negative value.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool PropertyNameCaseInsensitive { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.PropertyNameCaseInsensitive : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether a property's name uses a case-insensitive comparison during deserialization. The default value is .
Docs.value: to compare property names using case-insensitive comparison; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
There is a performance cost associated with case-insensitive comparison (that is, when `PropertyNameCaseInsensitive` is `true`).
For more information, see [How to serialize and deserialize JSON](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-how-to#case-insensitive-property-matching).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Text::Json::JsonNamingPolicy ^ PropertyNamingPolicy { System::Text::Json::JsonNamingPolicy ^ get(); void set(System::Text::Json::JsonNamingPolicy ^ value); };
member this.PropertyNamingPolicy : System.Text.Json.JsonNamingPolicy with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the policy used to convert a property's name on an object to another format, such as camel-casing, or to leave property names unchanged.
Docs.value: A property naming policy, or to leave property names unchanged.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The resulting property name is expected to match the JSON payload during deserialization, and will be used when writing the property name during serialization.
The policy is not used for properties that have a <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonPropertyNameAttribute> applied.
This property can be set to <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonNamingPolicy.CamelCase?displayProperty=nameWithType> to specify a camel-casing policy.
For more information, see [How to serialize and deserialize JSON](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-how-to#customize-json-names-and-values).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Text::Json::JsonCommentHandling ReadCommentHandling { System::Text::Json::JsonCommentHandling get(); void set(System::Text::Json::JsonCommentHandling value); };
member this.ReadCommentHandling : System.Text.Json.JsonCommentHandling with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines how comments are handled during deserialization.
Docs.value: A value that indicates whether comments are allowed, disallowed, or skipped.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
By default, a <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonException> is thrown during deserialization if a comment is encountered.
For more information, see [How to serialize and deserialize JSON](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-how-to#allow-comments-and-trailing-commas).

Docs.exception: This property was set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.
The comment handling enum is set to a value that is not supported (or not within the enum range).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Text::Json::Serialization::ReferenceHandling ^ ReferenceHandling { System::Text::Json::Serialization::ReferenceHandling ^ get(); void set(System::Text::Json::Serialization::ReferenceHandling ^ value); };
public: property bool WriteIndented { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.WriteIndented : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines whether JSON should use pretty printing. By default, JSON is serialized without any extra white space.
Docs.value: if JSON should pretty print on serialization; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
Pretty printing includes:
- Indenting nested JSON tokens. - Adding new lines - Adding white space between property names and values.
For more information, see [How to serialize and deserialize JSON](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-how-to#serialize-to-formatted-json).

Docs.exception: This property was set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.
